intro: Pancratium trianthum var. saharae, commonly known as the Saharan yellow flower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom during the cooler months. The plant has strap-like, evergreen leaves and produces a tall, slender stem with a single flower at the top. It is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments with minimal water, making it a resilient species in harsh climates. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens and botanical collections.
